body:
@carlosantoniodasilva now it gets messy, [this pull request](https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/6344) breaks the code, since when you call **t.time :bonus_time** it creates the field as a **:datetime** and when the code I wrote runs it never enters the if. Worse, if you try to dump the schema it will now show **t.datetime :bonus_time** effectively doing something you didn't do yourself.

So, now, there are two options I can think of, undoing the pull request above and letting the migration and the generated schema.rb be the same or raising an exception if people try to use **t.time** on SQLite, since the pull request above says it doesn't work.
